title: Business Live: VW nears dieselgate deal - BBC News
summary: ftse posts ninth consecutive record close .
labour leader jeremy corbyn calls for salary cap .
southern rail and ba cabin crew on strike again .

documents.title: good night
text: that 's it for another day on the business live page .
do join us again tomorrow at 6am when we 'll keep you posted on all the latest news , views and analysis from the world of finance .

documents.title: palau to go posh to cut tourists

however , if its president has his way , only the creme de la creme will be able to visit .

documents.title: wall street treads water ahead of results
text: there was little change in us shares at the close on tuesday ahead of a raft of .
company results in the coming weeks .
the dow jones was down a shade at 19,855.53 , that 's a fall of 31.85 points or 0.16 % .
the s & p 500 was unchanged at 2,268.90 .
and the tech-heavy nasdaq was up 20 points or 0.36 % at 5,551.82 .
since donald trump 's election victory us shares have soared .
now , though , investors have switched their attention to the results season to determine whether companies ' performance actually justifies such high values .

`` we 've shifted from that exuberance post the election and the rotation into some of the sectors and now we are entering a wait-and-see mode with earnings knocking at the front door , '' said art hogan , chief market strategist at wunderlich equity capital markets in news york .
`` earnings may be the pivot to move things higher . ''

documents.title: get into the groove
text: president barack obama recently joked that he was hoping for a job at spotify when he leaves the white house .
and it seems the music streaming service is keen to oblige him , after it posted on its careers page a vacancy for `` president of playlists . ''
the job ad says applicants should have `` at least eight years ' experience running a highly-regarded nation '' .
it also calls for `` a friendly and warm attitude , and a nobel peace prize '' .
read more here .

documents.title: why inequality still matters
text: icymi : inequality has reached a 30-year low .
so should we still care ?
article by @ twitterid
great analysis but also a bit depressing !

documents.title: adding up obama 's legacy
text: as barack obama prepares to say goodbye we look at his economic legacy @ twitterid @ twitterid
tend to think he has had a reasonably easy ride outwith america on the economic record

documents.title: giving it away
text: still in the us , the new york times brings us this story about a billionaire who has given away $ 8bn during his life .
apparently 85-year-old charles feeney ( `` chuck '' to his mates ) gave his whole fortune more than 30 years ago to atlantic philanthropies .
he had set up that organisation as an umbrella for a group of private foundations .
the money kept growing thanks to being invested in companies such as facebook and alibaba .
author: Ian Pollock
Business reporter

documents.title: 'good news ' for vw
text: analysts at evercore say the draft vw deal is intended to draw a line under all remaining us-related legal risk , which is `` good news '' .
`` we had a $ 3bn number in mind , but in the broader scheme of things we believe the most important news is that vw managed to come to an agreement that allows the company to move on from here .
it 's a major relief that this does n't get dragged into the new us administration . ''

they add : `` we assume that vw will increase its diesel provision in the area of €2-3bn to about €20bn to €21bn of course there are plenty of other items driving the size of the provision such as number of customers selling their car back to vw . ''

documents.title: the 'diesel issue '
text: vw 's statement is a masterpiece in not , in fact , telling the reader why it is set to cough up so much money to the us authorities .
the statement from the company refers - and only once - to what it coyly calls the `` diesel issue '' .

here is the only mention that vw cares to make of its scandalous behaviour in deliberately installing software in its car engines so that they could deceive the emissions controls of the us authorities :

`` the aim of the discussions is to reach a settlement agreement regarding the settlement of certain criminal investigations and certain civil fines in connection with the diesel issue in the usa , '' vw says .
author: Ian Pollock
Business reporter

documents.title: big bill
text: so to put that last paragraph from vw into english , the $ 4.3bn fine means that the total costs associated with the emissions cheating scandal are set to exceed the $ 19.2bn the company has set aside to handle the problem .
vw has already agreed to a $ 15b civil settlement with environmental authorities and car owners in the us .

documents.title: more financial pain awaits
text: the four-paragraph statement from vw issued tonight adds :
`` in case of a settlement agreement , the payment obligations are expected to lead to a financial expense that exceeds the current provisions .
the concrete impact regarding the annual result 2016 can not be defined at present due to its dependency on various further factors . ''

documents.title: guilty plea
text: the volkswagen settlement includes a guilty plea by the german company regarding certain us criminal law provisions and a statement of facts on the basis of which the fines have to be made , vw said .

documents.title: breakingvw to pay $ 4.3bn for emissions cheating
text: volkswagen will pay a $ 4.3bn fine to settle the us criminal case surrounding the emissions cheating scandal known as `` dieselgate '' .

the german company said it was in advanced talks with the us justice department and customs and border protection to settle the criminal investigations and civil fines , but it was subject to approval by vw 's board .
that approval could come later today .

documents.title: 'focus on the long term '
text: laith khalaf , senior analyst at hargreaves lansdown , says today 's ftse rally was given an unexpected boost today in the form of the supermarkets , after morrison issued a positive christmas trading statement .
`` while the ftse 100 stands at a record level , valuations on the uk stock market are not at abnormally high levels once you factor in the earnings produced by uk companies .

what 's more , the headline index does n't account for dividends , which are a key element of returns from the uk stock market , and are particularly attractive when interest rates are so low , '' he says .
`` as ever , the short term could bring feast or famine , but either way investors should keep focused on the long term , which is where the stock market really comes into its own . ''

documents.title: department for international trade appointment
text: liam fox 's department has a new chief mandarin .
intl trade sec @ twitterid delighted to announce @ twitterid as new dit permanent secretary
congratulations @ twitterid on the new appointment !
@ twitterid

documents.title: gm profits motor higher
text: general motors says it expects to post higher profits next year , countering analysts ' concerns that the us car industry peaked in 2016 after several years of record or near-record sales .
the company also announced a $ 5bn increase to its share buyback program and additional cost savings of $ 1bn .

america 's biggest car maker said sales of more profitable crossovers , trucks and suvs ( such as the new gmc terrain , would `` increase significantly '' to 52 % of sales volumes by 2020 , compared with 38 % over the previous six years .

documents.title: brexit talks 'must be grown-up '
text: brexit talks 'must be grown-up '

documents.title: sterling to hit $ 1.20 ?
text: sterling recovered from a slide to two-month lows against both the dollar and euro to end marginally higher today as a week of worry about brexit plans kept the currency under heavy pressure .
morning trade saw the pound add to losses of more than 1 % suffered on monday , before it steadied above $ 1.2100 and 87.50 pence per euro .

some analysts think it has further to fall , such as viraj patel at ing fx : `` the market is just piling in to sterling shorts following theresa may 's comments and given that we are expected to get a up in brexit noise .
we could even get a test of the $ 1.20 level in the next couple of weeks . ''

documents.title: corbyn uncapped
text: speaking of money matters , jeremy corbyn told radio 4 this morning he was in favour of a wage cap for the uk 's top earners .
however , in his speech in peterborough this afternoon he listed a series of alternative ways to tackle pay inequality - with no mention of a cap .

we could allow consumers to judge for themselves , with a government-backed kitemark for those companies that have agreed pay ratios between the pay of the highest and lowest earners with a recognised trade union .
we could ask for executive pay to be signed off by remuneration committees on which workers have a majority .
we could ensure higher earners pay their fair share by introducing a higher rate of income tax on the highest 5 % or 1 % of incomes .
we could offer lower rates of corporation tax for companies that do n't pay anyone more than a certain multiple of the pay of the lowest .
there are many options .
but what we can not accept is a society in which a few earn in two days and a bit , what a nurse , a shop worker , or a teacher do in a year .
it simply can not be right . ''

documents.title: unite takes aim at m & s
text: the striking ba cabin crew belonging to unite plan to up the ante tomorrow by handing in a letter to marks and spencer head office , calling on the retailer to support its campaign .
the union said the second day of the strike coincides with a roll-out of a new m & s food range on short-haul flights across british airways .

unite national officer oliver richardson said : `` cabin crew working for british airways ' 'mixed fleet ' , 36,000 feet up in the air , face earning up to £ 6,000 less basic pay than m & s staff selling the same food in store . ''

documents.title: breakinganother ftse record
text: it 's another record close for the ftse 100 at 7,275 points - that 's the ninth in a row for the blue-chip index .
miners dominated the risers today , with anglo american soaring more than 7 % , although tesco gained almost as much .
insurers direct line and admiral were the two biggest fallers .
the pound , meanwhile , is flat at $ 1.2167 .

documents.title: ba cancels 22 flights
text: as well as the strike on southern trains today , british airways cabin crew belonging to the unite union have also walked out today and tomorrow .
the airline said 22 flights to and from heathrow airport were cancelled today because of the strike out of 800 in total .
affected destinations include hamburg , dusseldorf , san jose , oslo and aberdeen , but flights have been merged so passengers will be able to reach their destinations , ba said .

documents.title: salary cap is 'completely idiotic '
text: david blanchflower is a former member of the bank of england monetary policy committee and was briefly an economic adviser to jeremy corbyn .
following the labour leader 's comments earlier today about imposing a salary cap , he 's given a forthright interview to the bbc news channel .
the economist says a salary cap is a `` completely idiotic idea '' that firms could easily get around .
it was `` another silly idea '' from mr corbyn that would be `` completely unworkable '' in a market-driven economy like the uk 's .
just in case we did n't get the message , professor blanchflower adds that a cap would be a `` totally lunatic '' idea .
author: BBC News Channel

documents.title: breakingnew bbc chairman
text: the department of culture .
media and sport said that sir david clementi has been confirmed as the bbc 's new chairman , after approval from downing street .

documents.title: is inequality in the uk getting worse ?
text: the claim : levels of inequality in the uk have been getting worse .
reality check verdict : official figures suggest that income distribution has become less unequal over the past decade .
read the full reality check here .
author: Reality Check

documents.title: no tears for boohoo
text: business live reader iain thomson emails to ask if we will be covering the trading updates from some of the online retailers this week , such as boohoo.com .
that plucky upstart did indeed slip through the net this morning , but is certainly worth a mention .
the youthful fashion purveyor has upgraded its full-year revenue forecasts following a bumper christmas trading period .
boohoo sales for the four months to december 31 rose 55 % to £ 114m , driven by a 31 % increase in uk sales to £ 65m .
as a result , boohoo expects sales growth of between 43 % and 45 % in the year to february 28 - above previous guidance of between 38 % and 42 % .

shares have risen by - wait for it - almost 300 % in the past 12 months ( we should all have listened to retail analyst nick bubb , who made boohoo his 2016 share tip ) and it 's now worth more than £ 1.6bn .

documents.title: spencer sells out
text: former tory party treasurer michael spencer is about £ 200m richer after offloading most of his shares in what is now called tp icap .
icap , mr spencer 's company - which is now known as nex group - bought tullett 's electronic broking arm as part of a swap deal that gave him a 9 % stake in tp icap .
that holding is now down to about 1 % .

documents.title: vw motors on
text: scandal ?
what scandal `` dieselgate '' does not appear to have done volkswagen too much reputational damage , given that it says it managed to flog a record 10.3 million cars worldwide last year .
the vw group , which also owns audi , porsche and skoda , increased sales by 3.8 % compared with 2015 , pushing it back over the magical 10-million mark after slipping to 9.93 million in 2015 .
sales of vw-branded cars rose 2.8 % to nearly six million units .

appointment of clementi as chair of bbc will be confirmed this afternoon
bankers on the left of them , bankers on the right of them

documents.title: breakingtraders to be charged
text: reuters reports that us authorities will charge three former traders at jpmorgan , citigroup and barclays in relation to a foreign exchange investigation , according to a source .

documents.title: ryanair overtakes lufthansa
text: bit of a moment for ryanair - last year it was well and truly europe 's biggest airline by passenger numbers .
last week the irish carried said it had 117 million passengers in 2016 - up 15 % .
today lufthansa reported a 1.8 % rise in its annual total to 109.7 million .
other budget carriers also did well , with norwegian air shuttle reporting a 14 % rise to 29 million and wizz air up 19 % to 22.7 million .
easyjet , which suffered more than low-cost rivals from strikes in france and tourists avoiding destinations hit by attacks , increased passenger numbers 6.6 % to 74.5 million .

documents.title: good afternoon !
text: thanks to russell and dearbail for keeping us up to date thus far today .
i 'm with you for the rest of tuesday 's business news and views - and doubtless a trump tweet or three .
got a comment on anything that 's happened today ?
email me at bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk or follow me on twitter : @ twitterid
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter

text: g'ment asks uk 's # nuclear regulator to begin approval process for chinese reactor planned for construction at bradwell in essex .

documents.title: fear and stealing in las vegas
text: a big scandal has emerged at the ces tech show in las vegas .
a gaming laptop with three screens has been stolen .
razer , the maker of the first of its kind portable laptop , is offering a $ 25,000 reward for any information that leads to an arrest .
read all about it here .

documents.title: volkswagen sales rise despite scandal
text: drivers appeared to shrug-off volkswagen 's emissions scandal and sent full-year sales of vehicles up by 3.8 % last year .
the embattled group delivered 10.3 million cars in 2016 .
in december alone , sales increased by 11.8 % to 933,300 vehicles .
europe as well as china showed strong demand but sales were flat in north american and down in south america .
its commercial vehicles were the best sellers over the year , up 11.4 % while the once much-vilified skoda reported sales up 6.8 % .
the emissions scandal shows little sign of abating .
on monday , court papers emerged claiming that some volkswagen executives knew about the cheating two months before it emerged but decided not to tell us regulators .

documents.title: over 60s enjoy pay boost as young lanquish
text: good news for those in the autumn of their years - over 60s got an income boost in 2016 .
the younger generation .
however , did not .
ons suggest continuation of long term trend in 2016 .
our figures show incomes of over 60s up 11 % 2007-14 , 31-59s no change ; 22-30s 7 % down
@ twitterid @ twitterid - what about the # waspi group ? ? ?
surely this needs analysing also in terms of gender ?
'31-59=no change ' propped up w/ personal debt may be cause of electorate # themnotusapathy ?
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: fine for stolen details
text: insurance giant royal and sun alliance has been fined £ 150,000 after a hard drive containing customer details was stolen .
the data included names , addresses and bank account details including account numbers and sort codes .
the device also held limited credit card details of 20,000 customers .
the device was stolen from its offices in west sussex .
the information was not encrypted and the device has never been found .
the information commissioner , which issued the fine , said the insurer did not follow simple steps to protect customers ' personal information .
author: Kevin Peachey
Personal finance reporter

documents.title: does the government understand ? finance executives at treasury committee
text: labour 's wes streeting asks the executives if they feel government understands the issues affecting the financial sector .
elizabeth corley , from allianz global investors , says there has been a `` rigorous '' exchange of information between her investment company and the treasury and department for exiting the eu .
it is the `` jenga '' game aspect of all the regulations and agreements covering financial services which will take time to understand , she says .
mr streeting asks the panel if there is a risk of what labour leader jeremy corbyn has called a `` bankers ' brexit '' , which overly favours the financial sector .
hsbc 's douglas flint repeats the point that hsbc is a `` mirror '' of what is happening in the real economy , whatever is good for the real economy will be good for banking .

documents.title: two arrested in ecb president email hack
text: italian police have arrested two people for hacking into thousands of emails including those of european central bank president , mario draghi .
others whose emails were hacked include matteo renzi , italy 's former prime minister and a number of cardinals in the vatican .

roberto di legami , director of the specialised cyber police unit that conducted the investigation , told reuters : `` there were tens of thousands of email accounts hacked , and among them were accounts belonging to bankers , businessmen and even several cardinals in the vatican . ''
he said an investigation into how the information was used is ongoing and added that 99 % of the data was stored in the us .

documents.title: brexit holy grailfinance executives at treasury committee
text: focussing on a possible transition deal for the financial services sector , the london stock exchange 's xavier rolet told mps that the holy grail was to find a way to `` maintain , nurture and promote '' what has made the uk economy one of the best global performers , while preserving a strong trading relationship with the eu .

`` i think there is a way to turn this process into a positive for both economies , but it is really essential that we find a way to buy ourselves a period of time of stability of grandfathering that needs to extend into several years - two years is just too short - so we can maintain those benefits . ''

documents.title: supermarkets and miners lead ftse 100
text: the ftse 100 has extended early gains , and at midday was 0.39 % up at 7,266 points .
miners and supermarkets were the big gainers .
anglo american was up 6.45 % , helped by a rise in metals prices and a recommendation by analysts at barclays .
morrisons rose 3.66 % after posting strong christmas sales figures .
sterling slipped further , and was down 0.23 % against the dollar and 0.26 % against the euro .

documents.title: new york wants our businessbusiness editor tweets on treasury committee hearing
text: xavier rolet tells mps nyc very keen to get hands on london 's derivative clearing business so would n't help smooth any brex reg problems .
let nyc have it > derivatives clearing does very little for uk economy & any derivatives are a timebomb for lse imho

documents.title: post-brexit planstreasury committee
text: conservative jacob rees-mogg asks about the kind of contingency plans that the financial services sector is likely to put in place .
hsbc 's douglas flint ( above ) repeats a point he made on an earlier question that his bank 's plans will all be `` client led '' .

but mr rees-mogg presses mr flint on hsbc 's claims that 1,000 jobs in the uk could be at risk if the uk loses passporting rights , as the eu would have to impose `` extreme '' capital controls to prevent transactions continuing .
he suggests that `` reverse solicitation '' rules would allow a uk bank without passporting rights to continue to do business with eu-based clients .
mr flint says such clear-cut cases of `` reverse solicitation '' are rare under the complex regulations governing how financial services are conducted across borders .
he is reluctant to agree that reliance on reverse solicitation could be a contingency plan for financial services post-brexit .

documents.title: could 'good will ' lead to a faster agreement ? bank executives at treasury committee hearing
text: conservative steve baker ( above ) asks if a long transition period would really just delay the necessary decisions on financial services .
he cites a report from the legatum institute laying out a possible timetable of 18 months .
hsbc 's douglas flint says with `` good will on all sides '' , agreements could be reached , and agrees there are good economic reasons to make that happen .

elizabeth corley , from allianz global investors , sticks to her point that she does not believe it is possible to go down to the level of legal detail across all agreements and directives within 18 months .

and xavier rolet , chief executive of the london stock exchange , says a faster timetable could be possible if the eu allows the uk to begin developing trade agreements with the us and others , whilst still being within the eu , which is currently against the rules of membership .

documents.title: post office closuresbbc industry correspondent tweets :
text: news - post office 'to close more crown branches ' - locations incl bootle , falkirk , camborne , harlesden , dundee

documents.title: the practicalities of movingbank executives at treasury committee hearing
text: hsbc 's douglas flint tells mps that there are real practical difficulties for staff who may have to move if some banking operations are transferred from the uk post-brexit .
`` it could be disruptive for families .
people are saying , if i 'm going to be asked to move in 18 months i 'd rather go now , because of schooling and things like that . ''
hsbc has been looking at a variety of contingency plans .
`` people have to be trained and moved , or recruited , '' mr flint says .
france and dublin are two possible locations for any operations that might have to be shifted from the uk , he tells mps .

documents.title: bank exit : 'nobody wants to push the button'banking executives at treasury committee
text: asked whether or not bank bosses had their hands `` poised quivering over the relocate button '' as previously suggested by the chief executive of the british bankers ' association , anthony browne , hsbc 's douglas flint said it depended on what access lenders already had to europe .
`` i think the 'quivering over the relocate button ' is dependent on business model and what you use the uk for , '' mr flint said .

`` if you are a fund institution hubbing in the eu from london , you really have no choice but to think very quickly and carefully about how you replicate the access to the eu when the uk leaves the european union .
`` if you have already established an operation in the eu you can take your time to decide whether or not to move quickly more leisurely , seeing how the negotiations flow .
`` but a bank like us with operations all over the eu including a significant full-service bank in france , you can take even longer to decide when to push the button .
`` nobody wants to push the button because the best outcome for everybody is the preservation of the status quo insofar as is possible , '' he tells mps .

documents.title: brexit and transitionbbc business editor tweets on treasury committee hearing
text: xavier rolet ( lse ceo ) says there should be a 5 year transitional period from triggering article 50 to maintain stability .
@ twitterid but there is a two year period .

documents.title: uk financial services jobs 'at risk '
text: xavier rolet says that customers `` simply would not wait '' and would move operations out of the uk if the london stock exchange did not provide a clear plan for post-brexit operations .
he outlined the risk to financial services jobs in the uk : `` i 'm not just talking about the clearing jobs themselves which number into the few thousands .

but the very large array of ancillary functions , whether it 's syndication , trading , treasury management , middle office , back office , risk management , software , which range into far more than just a few thousand or tens of thousands of jobs .
they would then start migrating . ''

documents.title: london economy 'like jenga tower'bbc personal finance correspondent writes
text: `` economic system ( in london ) is like a jenga tower , '' says hsbc boss doug flint .
you do n't know what will happen if you pull pieces out
how profound .
when do they get to the but about him talking shit about brexit ?
@ twitterid you do know what happens to the tower in every game though

documents.title: lse boss calls for 'grandfathering '
text: xavier rolet keeps repeating the point that the projected two years of negotiation between the uk and europe is `` too short '' and that there must be a process of `` grandfathering '' - where the old arrangements exist alongside the new - in place .

documents.title: eu to 'claim back ' uk 's clearing industry
text: europe wants to claim the uk 's clearing industry post-brexit , according to the boss of the london stock exchange .
xavier rolet tells the tsc that just a few days after the result of the referendum the leader of one european country said `` thought to claim back from the uk '' .

documents.title: hsbc would take 'preemptive action ' on relocationbbc economic editor writes
text: `` we wd take pre-emptive action '' on moving operations to france , holland or ireland before article 50 process completed - douglas flint hsbc
yeah we believe them .
how will this affect the rigging by hsbc and other banks of the precious metals markets ?
uk has to become a tax hacen
i ca n't like this tweet .
bad news for the uk economy .
do we know which operations he means ?
is there a link ?

documents.title: hsbc must ensure continuity of service
text: hsbc chairman douglas flint says whether the bank relocates from the uk post-article 50 `` depends on business modelling and what you use the uk for '' .
he said that if a business has operations in europe - which hsbc does - it can take its time to decide if it needs to relocate people from the uk .
mr flint said he does not want to push the bottom on relocation but said the bank needs to satisfy regulators on continuity of service .

documents.title: l'oreal pays $ 1.3bn for skincare brands
text: french cosmetics company l'oreal is buying three specialised skincare brands for $ 1.3bn from valeant pharmaceuticals .
l'oreal is purchasing cerave , acnefree and ambi to add to existing lines vichy and la roche-posay in its active cosmetics division .

frederic roze , president and chief executive of l'oreal usa , said : `` these three brands , built on strong relationships with health professionals and widely distributed , will nearly double the revenue of our active cosmetics division in the us and will help us satisfy the growing demand for active skincare at accessible prices . ''
the global skincare market was estimated to be worth $ 121bn in 2016 and is expected to grow to $ 154bn in 2021 according to statista .

documents.title: lse boss warns brexit poses systemic risk
text: london stock exchange boss , xavier rolet , has warned of systemic risk and massive job losses if the government fails to provide some clarity on its plans for brexit .

documents.title: hsbc chairman calls for brexit clarity
text: hsbc chairman douglas flint answers questions from the treasury select committee first .
he is calling for more clarity on the plans for brexit to give the banking sector time to talk to european counterparts about common ground .
he also tells the treasury select committee that post-brexit , businesses are in `` wait and see '' mode .

documents.title: ons publishes latest income databbc personal finance correspondent tweets :
text: retired household incomes up 13 % in last 8 years , while non-retired income down 1.2 % , stripping out inflation
richest fifth of households saw real incomes fall back last year , as pay came under pressure - poorest up £ 700 , richest down £ 1,000 a year
older incomes buoyed by private pensions and triple lock on state pension , but non-retired income still lower ( £ 22,000 v. £ 28,000 ) says ons

documents.title: mps grill city leaders over brexit
text: three of the financial sector 's leading figures are getting ready to be questioned by mps over whether the industry exaggerated the potential impact of brexit prior to the referendum .

douglas flint , chairman of hsbc , elizabeth corley , vice chairwoman of allianz global investors , and xavier rolet , chief executive of the london stock exchange , are facing the cross-party treasury select committee .

documents.title: household incomes risebbc personal finance correspondent tweets :
text: ty household incomes rose £ 600 to £ 26,300 after tax , between 2015 and 2016 say official stats from ons .
i 'm easily confused as you know but presumably a 'ty household ' is more than 1 person .
what 's a ty individual income ?
a household can have just one person
but in this case would include all those with more than one , no ?
ave. salary i believe is £ 27,600 .
yes but that 's from ashe , i think , which is a different survey
potato/potarto question is much does the average household earn ?
less than the average salary ?
more than the average wage ?
ty household expenditure = ?
one means nothing without the other eg rates in my district set to rise 4.74 %

documents.title: volvo 's autonomous family
text: it makes a change from unveiling cars , i suppose .
volvo choose the detroit motor show to unveil a family - the hain family , from gothenburg , sweden .
it 's all part of the carmaker 's drive to develop autonomous vehicles .
volvo wanted some 'real life ' consumers to give it the edge on what people want from their cars .
and the hains ( here with volvo chief executive hakan samuelsson on the right ) got the honour to take part in some real life autonomous driving in real life road conditions .
good luck .

documents.title: baby boomers v millennials
text: have career prospects improved or worsened for different generations ?
a father and daughter discuss the issue .

documents.title: corbyn : pay cap would help inequality
text: jeremy corbyn says a maximum earnings cap would help narrow the gap between the rich and the poor .
the labour leader told the bbc 's today programme : `` the point i 'm trying to make is that we have the worst levels of income disparity in most of the oecd countries in this country .
it is getting worse and this is part of it .
if we want to live in a more egalitarian society and fund our public services we can not go on creating worst levels of inequality . ''

documents.title: supermarkets gain from weekend christmas
text: it looks like christmas cheer spread across all britain 's supermarkets after shoppers spent £ 480m more at the tills compared with 2015 .
market researchers kantar worldpanel said total market sales rose by 1.8 % for the 12 weeks to 1 january 2017 .
it said that the rise was helped by the timing of christmas eve and christmas day which fell on a weekend .

head of retail and consumer insight fraser mckevitt said : `` with christmas eve falling on a saturday and giving shoppers more time to buy their final festive trimmings , the single busiest shopping day of the year was friday 23 december with over half the population braving a grocery store .
`` the ty household spend for december reached £ 365 this year - £ 52 more than the average month . ''
this morning , morrisons reported better than expected festive like-for-like sales of 2.9 % .

documents.title: another day , another train strikebbc transport correspondent tweets from croydon as southern strike bites
text: queuing for a train at east croydon # southernstrike
@ twitterid mad ting
@ twitterid are you sure it 's not the queue for @ twitterid with it being croydon
what a joke !
crazy , literally no queue at all at 7.45am !
catch the tram there , it takes you to the middle of nowhere in both directions .
@ twitterid sod that ! ! ! !
what a joke .
@ twitterid it 's like going to alton towers only a lot more disappointing

documents.title: corbyn wants to introduce earnings cap
text: labour leader jeremy corbyn has said wants to introduce a law to cap maximum earnings for the rich .
mr corbyn told bbc 's today programme : `` i would like there to be some kind of high earnings cap '' , adding that he wants to `` look '' at a `` max earnings limit '' law .
he declined to comment on what the maximum would be .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: ftse 100 heads higher
text: supermarkets morrisons and tesco are leading the ftse 100 higher .
the former 's shares up are 4.34 % on the back of its christmas sales boost , while the later is rising on its coattails , up 3.68 % .
financial stocks are the main losers , with prudential failing 1.53 % .
about 30 minutes into trading , the ftse 100 is up 0.19 % at 7,251.6 points .

documents.title: tip top : china closer to ballpoint pen success
text: china 's 3,000 pen makers produce millions of ballpoint pens every year .
but did you know , they have not been fully chinese-made ?
despite being capable of manufacturing planes , smartphones and spacecraft , the country has struggled to make good enough quality steel for the pen tip , and so has had to rely on imports .
even premier li keqiang weighed in - bemoaning the failure of his country to produce a good quality version of this seemingly-simple implement .
but now state media says a firm has cracked the problem and is producing its own tips - writing a new chapter for the chinese pen industry .
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia Business Reporter

documents.title: whitbread apologises over 'beef ' lasagne
text: restaurant group whitbread has apologised after reports that its beef lasagne included pork , which some people do n't eat for religious reasons .
whitbread said some menus at its outlets had not been updated .
the company 's outlets include brewers fayre , table table and whitbread inn .
according to the sun newspaper , the beef/pork lasagne had been served up for months .

whitbread , which also owns the costa coffee chain and premier inn hotels , told the sun : `` we would like to apologise sincerely to our customers for any concern or confusion this may have caused . ''

documents.title: morrisons shares jump to three-year high
text: shares in morrisons jumped 4.5 % to 248.2p in early trading after the supermarket group said that it had enjoyed its strongest christmas performance for seven years .
its shares are now trading at the highest level since january 2014 .

documents.title: upmarket food and drink powers morrisons
text: morrisons highlights in today 's trading statement that sales of its best range fared well over christmas and that over half of customer baskets included at least one premium item .
this chimes with aldi 's figures on monday , when it announced a 15 % rise in total sales for the festive season , with its specially selected range doing particularly well .
maureen hinton , group research director at verdict research , said that people were trading up - but with caution .
`` we want good prices when we are trading up , '' she says .

documents.title: morrisons sees christmas sales jumpbbc retail correspondent tweets :
text: dave potts , # morrisons ceo , says : `` we 've found our form . ''
found nice piece on activist helping to unlock value , they could help boost even more perhaps ?
@ twitterid from a low and depressed base to be fair .
potts : `` our customers were feeling quite chipper over xmas . ''

documents.title: morrisons : leadership delivers turnaround
text: maureen hinton , group research director at verdict retail , commended the management of morrisons for its stronger than expected rise in like-for-like sales over christmas .
she tells the bbc 's today programme : `` the leadership of david potts has worked out very well for it . ''
ms hinton also highlighted morrisons ' deal with amazon as giving the supermarket `` an advantage '' over other retailers .
last year , the us internet giant began offering grocery sales through amazon prime now with goods sourced from morrisons which can be delivered in one or two hour slots .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: morrisons turns the cornerbbc business presenter tweets :
text: former director @ twitterid tells me on @ twitterid that we 're seeing a return to the glory days .
turning around in a `` very morrison 's way '' .

documents.title: morrisons sales risebbc retail correspondent tweets :
text: stonking figs from # morrisons over christmas .
up by nearly 3 % , despite tougher comps and deflation .
thought you meant the things that go in fig rolls at first !

documents.title: majestic wine toasts sales growth
text: another retailer to enjoy some christmas cheer was majestic wine .
it 's group sales in the 10 weeks to 2 january rose by 15.3 % on the same period a year ago .
the high street arm , majestic retail , had its best christmas with like-for-like sales up 7.5 % year-on-year .
chief executive rowan gormley is a happy man , saying in a statement : `` our transformation plan is working and we remain on track to achieve our £ 500m sales goal .
we said that we would be better prepared for christmas than ever - and the numbers show that we did what we said we would do . ''

documents.title: more tills and products lifted morrisons sales , says chief
text: david potts , who took over as morrisons ' chief executive in 2015 following the supermarket 's five tempestuous years under dalton philip , said : `` this christmas we made further improvements to the customer shopping trip .
`` we stocked more of what our customers wanted to buy , more tills were open more often , and product availability improved as over half of sales went through our new ordering system . ''
morrisons said that fruit and veg , beers , wines & spirits , its best range and nutmeg clothing all performed well .

documents.title: morrisons upgrades profit forecast
text: morrisons has upgraded its full-year profits forecast after its `` strongest performance for seven years '' over christmas .
the supermarket group said it now expects profits to reach between £ 330m and £ 340m compared with previous forecasts of £ 326m .
like-for-like sales , which strip out revenue from stores opened during the nine weeks to 1 january , jumped 2.9 % .
including fuel , revenue rose by 4.7 % .

documents.title: trinity confirms express newspaper talks
text: the trinity mirror newspaper group has confirmed it is in talks with richard desmond about buying some of his media assets , which include the express papers .

in a short statement , trinity said : `` the board of trinity mirror plc notes the recent media speculation and confirms that it is at an early stage of discussions towards taking a minority interest in a new company comprising certain of northern & shell 's assets .
`` no offer has been made and there is no certainty that any agreement will be reached .
`` a further announcement will be made if and when appropriate . ''

documents.title: breakingmorrisons christmas sales jump 2.9 %
text: like-for-like sales rose 2.9 % at morrisons over christmas , which the supermarket said was its strongest performance for seven years .
the supermarket is the first of britain 's big four to report trading for the festive period .
this is the second christmas period overseen by boss david potts who took over as chief executive from dalton philips in 2015 and has launched a major restructuring .

documents.title: slap-up christmas saves retail sales
text: it 's a good job people wanted a slap-up christmas or 2016 would have been a poor year for retailers .
helen dickinson , chief executive of the british retail consortium , tells the today programme that before december , trading was lower than in 2015 .
research from the brc and kpmg found that like-for-like trade in december rose by 1 % , powered by a major increase in food sales .
ms dickinson says that half of the increase was due to food .
the research also found that fewer people shopped online in december .
ms dickinson said £ 1 in £ 4 spent on non-food sales is online , but added that while previously people either shopped online or in stores , there was now a more even spread between the two .

documents.title: supermarkets 'will cut more jobs '
text: as financial markets brace for morrisons christmas trading figures this morning , jane sydenham , investment director at rathbones , tells the bbc 's today programme that she expects the supermarket sector to continue to restructure and reorganise .
she reckons that british supermarkets , still battling with the german discounters aldi and lidl , will cut jobs following tesco 's announcement on monday evening that it will shed 1,000 staff .
`` we 'll see some job losses but it will not be shrinkage , it will be reorganisation and restructuring , '' she says .
while ms sydenham believes that the falling value of the pound will affect prices , she says that consumers will not bare the full brunt .
it will be a `` mixed-bag '' where shoppers will be hit be some rising , but increases will also be absorbed by the supermarkets and their suppliers , she says .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: china producer prices rise
text: china 's producer prices rose at their swiftest pace in more than five years in december .
the producer price index rose 5.5 % year-on-year last month , the national bureau of statistics says , far more than economists ' expectations of 4.6 % .

it marked the fourth straight month of price rises for goods at the factory gate after years of declines , and an acceleration from the previous month 's 3.3 % , raising expectations china 's factories could put upward pressure on global prices through the supply chain .

some analysts worry the strong gains in producer prices may also be fueled by growing speculation in commodities futures markets , adding to the broader risk of bubbles in china 's economy even as leaders attempt to control explosive growth in debt .
`` i do n't think there 's an inflation issue in china , it 's an asset bubble , '' said commerzbank senior emerging market economist zhou hao in singapore .

documents.title: desmond 'in talks ' to sell tabloids
text: publisher richard desmond is in talks with newspaper group trinity mirror to sell his tabloid titles , according to bloomberg .
the news agency reports that the sale would involve desmond off-loading his daily express , sunday express , daily star , daily star sunday newspapers .
mr desmond owns northern & shell , which also publishes ok !
magazine and runs the health lottery .

documents.title: yahoo chief mayer to leave company 's board
text: yahoo has confirmed that chief executive marissa mayer will quit the company 's board after its merger with verizon .
mayer is expected to remain with yahoo 's core business , which is being bought by the us telecom giant .
yahoo is selling its main operating business as a way to separate that from its more valuable stake in chinese internet giant alibaba .

documents.title: asian shares head lower
text: asian shares have traded mostly lower on tuesday with a stronger yen once again weighing on japanese stocks .
the nikkei 225 in tokyo wrapped up the day 0.6 % lower .
toyota had seen a strong start to the trading day on the back of a $ 10bn us investment , but the carmaker 's shares closed 0.5 % down .
in australia , the asx 200 finished 08 % down while south korea 's kospi wrapped 0.2 % lower .
chinese markets are still trading and the shanghai composite is flat , while hong kong 's hang seng is 0.6 % higher .
author: Andreas Illmer
Business reporter in Singapore

documents.title: mexico : 'fear and uncertainty '
text: us president-elect donald trump has made no secret of his feelings about carmakers producing models in mexico .
and his trade-by-twitter tactics are bordering on the `` bullying '' , says roberto salinas leon , president of the mexico business forum .
he tells wake up to money that the pressure being put on carmakers to cut investment in mexico is creating `` fear and uncertainty '' in the country .
bmw 's comment yesterday that it would press on with its plans in mexico was `` a breath of fresh air '' , he says .
some other carmakers , however , have reined back investments .
`` it 's a lose-lose for both countries , '' he warns .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: snapchat firm sends britain a message
text: snap , the company behind messaging app snapchat , is setting up its international hq in britain , where it will book all sales made outside the uk .
many tech firms have preferred ireland , luxembourg or the netherlands as their european tax base .
a snap spokeswoman told the bbc this morning : i am happy to confirm that the uk is the snap inc. family 's hub outside the us .
the uk 's strong creative industries make this a great place to build a global business . ''
los angeles-based snap is expected to float this year , with a valuation of around $ 25bn .

documents.title: retail sees late christmas boost
text: a last-minute shopping rush in the days leading up to christmas seem to have boosted sales in december despite a weaker performance from online retailers , according to a survey .
december 's like-for-like sales surpassed black friday in november , climbing 1 % year-on-year compared with a rise of 0.1 % for december 2015 , the british retail consortium-kpmg survey found .
however , online retailers failed to match previous christmas performances , with annual online sales of non-food products lifting 7.2 % over the period in contrast to 15.1 % a year earlier .
helen dickinson , brc chief executive , says trading over christmas had exceeded expectations after getting off to a slow start .
`` it was a polarised month as shoppers held out for the christmas week .
`` food sales were the major contributor to total growth , while non-food sales on the other hand were sluggish overall , despite a strong performance by categories driven by gifting items . ''
